instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message:
working on a [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL] card liquid damage.
liquid damages around pch area, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area and i have replace keyboard connecter for missing pin 5 on it.

i have light on usb mous.
No pictures on external screen (using mini display port)
Have trayd PRAM reset with no luck
Have cleaned card in the UC

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> give 0V on pin 5-6
<SIGNAL>PPVCOMP_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0,009V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message: Vcore present on L7310? <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8 checked?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message:
L7310 give 1.743V 
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8 give 0V and showing 0,616 in diode mode

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message: Think i have a brooken trace between  <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> pin10 and <CAPACITOR>C4850</CAPACITOR> pin1

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message: and how would <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> affect power on. Did you even look at the diagram and check what <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8 is?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message:
Yes pin 8 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
and <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> pin 10 is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

also missing pin 9 and 4 on <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no pic no light no chime
threads.message: So what voltage needs to be present on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8?
